column2: The use of opium has spread throughout the land. Farmers and laborers fail to turn up for work, and entire fields fall fallow, as the people slip further and further down into the mists of consuming dependence.
The consumption of opium has been outlawed. Only time will tell if this ban is successful.
Now that we are in control of most of the world's supply of opium we can monopolize the drug trade in China.
They will not complain if they know what's good for them.
The opium trade with China has become untenable for us and our merchants have already begun to pull out of Chinese markets.
Our inability to protect our interests against the uncivilized Chinese has greatly diminished our standing among the Great Powers.
The chinese government has burned our recent shipments of opium and expelled our merchants from their shores. Our economy will suffer a serious blow if the ban stays in place. What shall we do?
Force them to lift the ban and make sign a new ÔΩßGUnequal Chinese TreatyÔΩßb.

It is time we banned the use of this poison and expel the foreign barbarians that forced this drug upon us. Beware that enacting this decision will give other countries the Opium War casus belli against us.

This cb will give us the "Unequal Chinese Treaty" modifier that gives +2% tax efficiency, +5% tariff efficiency, and +0.2 daily research points while giving China the "Opium Addiction" modifier. If China owns Hong Kong they will also be forced to cede that province to us.
Take a treaty port from China.

The political reforms enacted in the past few years have led to a situation where the extended constitutionalism of our Monarchy has become a problem.For this reason, we have decided to take a step back from the reforms made and give the king more powers again.
It is the right thing to do
A little dirt in our society can be accepted, but when the garbage accumulates too much it becomes a problem. Time to "clean up" this garbage, for the good of our nation
The Union of Socialist States of Iran
